intro: Kosteletzkya pentacarpos var. smilacifolia, commonly known as the smilacifolia variant of the five-seeded knotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its climbing habit and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain five seeds, typical of the genus Kosteletzkya. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. This variant is notable for its adaptability to various soil types and its role in ecological systems as a food source for certain insects.
